title: Personalized Workout Program Creator
description: Answer these questions to get a custom workout program designed specifically for you

questions.question: What's your primary fitness goal?
questions.description: This helps determine the overall structure and focus of your program

options.label: Build Muscle & Strength
options.description: Focus on hypertrophy and progressive strength training

options.label: Lose Fat & Get Lean
options.description: Combine strength training with metabolic conditioning

options.label: Athletic Performance
options.description: Improve power, speed, agility for sports

options.label: General Health & Fitness
options.description: Overall wellness and functional movement

options.label: Injury Recovery & Rehab
options.description: Therapeutic exercise and gradual return to activity

options.label: Body Recomposition
options.description: Build muscle while losing fat simultaneously

questions.question: What's your experience level with structured training?
questions.description: This affects exercise complexity and progression schemes

options.label: Complete Beginner
options.description: New to structured exercise (0-3 months)

options.label: Beginner
options.description: Some experience with basic exercises (3-12 months)

options.label: Intermediate
options.description: Comfortable with compound movements (1-3 years)

options.label: Advanced
options.description: Experienced lifter with solid technique (3+ years)

options.label: Expert/Competitive
options.description: Competitive athlete or very experienced (5+ years)

questions.question: How many days per week can you realistically commit to training?
questions.description: Be honest about your schedule - consistency is more important than frequency

options.label: 2 Days per Week
options.description: Full body workouts, perfect for beginners or busy schedules

options.label: 3 Days per Week
options.description: Full body or upper/lower split

options.label: 4 Days per Week
options.description: Upper/lower split or push/pull/legs

options.label: 5 Days per Week
options.description: Body part splits or push/pull/legs with extra day

options.label: 6 Days per Week
options.description: Push/pull/legs twice or specialized split

options.label: 7 Days per Week (Daily)
options.description: Advanced training with active recovery days

questions.question: How much time do you have per workout session?
questions.description: This determines exercise volume and rest periods

options.label: 20-30 minutes
options.description: Quick, efficient workouts focusing on compound movements

options.label: 30-45 minutes
options.description: Good balance of volume and efficiency

options.label: 45-60 minutes
options.description: Standard workout duration with adequate volume

options.label: 60-90 minutes
options.description: Longer sessions allowing for higher volume

options.label: 90+ minutes
options.description: Extended training sessions for advanced athletes

options.label: Flexible/Varies
options.description: Different durations on different days

questions.question: What equipment do you have access to?
questions.description: This determines which exercises we can include in your program

options.label: Commercial Gym
options.description: Full access to barbells, dumbbells, machines, cables

options.label: Home Gym (Full Setup)
options.description: Power rack, barbells, dumbbells, bench, plates

options.label: Home Gym (Basic)
options.description: Dumbbells, resistance bands, maybe a bench

options.label: Dumbbells Only
options.description: Adjustable or fixed weight dumbbells

options.label: Bodyweight Only
options.description: No equipment, using body weight and creativity

options.label: Minimal Equipment
options.description: Limited space/equipment, need creative solutions

questions.question: Do you have a preference for how your training is organized?
questions.description: Different splits work better for different goals and schedules

options.label: No Preference
options.description: Let the AI choose what's best for my goals

options.label: Full Body
options.description: Train all muscle groups each session

options.label: Upper/Lower Split
options.description: Alternate between upper and lower body days

options.label: Push/Pull/Legs
options.description: Separate pushing, pulling, and leg movements

options.label: ULPPL (Upper/Lower/Push/Pull/Legs)
options.description: 5-day rotation focusing on upper, lower, push, pull, and legs

questions.question: How do you prefer to incorporate cardiovascular training?
questions.description: Cardio can be integrated or separate based on your preference

options.label: Minimal/None
options.description: Focus purely on strength training

options.label: Integrated (Circuit Style)
options.description: Short rest periods, metabolic conditioning

options.label: Separate Cardio Sessions
options.description: Dedicated cardio days or post-workout

options.label: HIIT/Sprint Intervals
options.description: High intensity interval training

options.label: LISS (Steady State)
options.description: Longer, moderate intensity cardio

options.label: Sport-Specific
options.description: Cardio that mimics my sport/activity

questions.question: How long would you like this program to last?
questions.description: Programs should be followed consistently before making major changes

options.label: 3 Weeks
options.description: Quick start or trial program

options.label: 4 Weeks
options.description: Short introduction or specific focus program

options.label: 6 Weeks
options.description: Good for beginners or specific adaptations

options.label: 8 Weeks
options.description: Standard program length for most goals

options.label: 12 Weeks
options.description: Comprehensive program with multiple phases

options.label: 16 Weeks
options.description: Extended program for significant transformations

options.label: Ongoing/Flexible
options.description: Program I can follow indefinitely with progressions

questions.question: How do you prefer to progress in your training?
questions.description: Different progression schemes work better for different goals

options.label: Linear Progression
options.description: Gradually increase intensity, decrease volume (e.g., 5 reps → 4 reps → 3 reps, heavier weight each week)

options.label: Volume Progression
options.description: Increase sets/reps while keeping weight constant (e.g., 3x8 → 4x10 → 4x12)

options.label: Density Progression
options.description: Same work in less time OR more work in same time (e.g., EMOM, AMRAP, circuits)

options.label: Wave Loading
options.description: Undulating intensity - peak middle weeks, deload final week (advanced)

options.label: No Preference
options.description: Let the program choose based on my goals
